clinical_question: Should patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs naïve RA and low disease activity receive csDMARD monotherapy or csDMARD combination (double or triple) therapy?
population: Patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs naïve RA and low disease activity
outcome: Disease activity (follow up: 1 year; assessed with: DAS 44 (Lower values – > benefit) (MCID -1.2 based on the EULAR criteria)

Risk of bias.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Lack of allocation concealment in both studies, high risk of attrition bias in one of the two studies.

Indirectness.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious indirectness. The evidence is based on a population with moderate to high disease activity.

Annotation.data:
1. csDMARD double therapy includes: MTZ+SSZ
2. csDMARD monotherapy includes: MTX or SSZ

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs naïve RA and low disease activity receive csDMARD monotherapy or csDMARD combination (double or triple) therapy?
population: Patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs naïve RA and low disease activity
outcome: Disability (follow up: 1 year; assessed with: HAQ-DI (Lower values – > benefit) (MCID -0.22 )

Risk of bias.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Lack of allocation concealment in both studies, high risk of attrition bias in one of the two studies.

Indirectness.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious indirectness. The evidence is based on a population with moderate to high disease activity.

Annotation.data:
1. csDMARD double therapy includes: MTZ+SSZ
2. csDMARD monotherapy includes: MTX or SSZ

clinical_question: Should patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs naïve RA and low disease activity receive csDMARD monotherapy or csDMARD combination (double or triple) therapy?
population: Patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs naïve RA and low disease activity
outcome: Pain (follow up: 1 year; assessed with: VAS 0-100 (Lower values – > benefit) (MCID -11.9)

Risk of bias.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Lack of allocation concealment.

Indirectness.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious indirectness. The evidence is based on a population with moderate to high disease activity.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Low sample size.

Annotation.data:
1. csDMARD double therapy includes: MTZ+SSZ
2. csDMARD monotherapy includes: MTX or SSZ

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs naïve RA and low disease activity receive csDMARD monotherapy or csDMARD combination (double or triple) therapy?
population: Patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs naïve RA and low disease activity

Risk of bias.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Lack of allocation concealment.

Indirectness.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious indirectness. The evidence is based on a population with moderate to high disease activity.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence intervals includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm. Small sample size, very low number of events.

Annotation.data:
1. csDMARD double therapy includes: MTZ+SSZ
2. csDMARD monotherapy includes: MTX or SSZ

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs naïve RA and low disease activity receive csDMARD monotherapy or csDMARD combination (double or triple) therapy?
population: Patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs naïve RA and low disease activity
outcome: Withdrawal due to lack of efficacy (follow up: 1 year)

Risk of bias.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious risk of bias. Lack of allocation concealment in both studies, high risk of attrition bias in one of the two studies.

Indirectness.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious indirectness. The evidence is based on a population with moderate to high disease activity.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by two levels due to very serious imprecision. Confidence intervals includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting harm. Small sample size, very low number of events.

Annotation.data:
1. csDMARD double therapy includes: MTZ+SSZ
2. csDMARD monotherapy includes: MTX or SSZ

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio
